channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report E-2023070567
item.description:
Report E-2023070567

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 5, 2023, two (2) 55-gallon drums of adhesive were punctured by a forklift and released approximately eighteen (18) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroCare (EC) to remediate the site. EC personnel deployed granular absorbents to the adhesive-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the two (2) 55-gallon damaged drums were containerized into two (2) 95-gallon over packs for terminal disposal

item.title: Report X-2023070644
item.description:
Report X-2023070644

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LEAKING CORROSIVE LIQUID OXIDIZER DURING TRANSIT, UNLOADED PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND A RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP LEAKING CORROSIVE LIQUID OXIDIZER SOILING A WET PUNCTURED TORN OPENED BOX AND SOILING ALL CONTENTS INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND A RED HAZMAT TOTE.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the large batteries (un2794) had fallen over and released 4 gallons of acid. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
